intro: Gilia ochroleuca subsp. lanosa, commonly known as the woolly gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites. Gilia ochroleuca subsp. lanosa is a perennial species that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
